page.title: 10Winter 81/82 at Edge
page.content: The winter of 1981/82 was one of the worst winters experianced in the Stroud area.In some areas the snow was as much as 6 or 7 feet deep and we heard a story about a man who lives on the main road below Whiteshill school having to dig a tunnel through the snow in order to get out of his front door. An article in the local paper said "A resourceful resident in Edge who had been snowed in for 10 days in January has bought a Â£980 snowblower ready for the next arctic onslaught". Teachers at our school said it was awful getting there and the police were turning people back.One man said he remembered the trees being covered with ice which didn't melt for weeks. Other hazards included freezing fog.
